Bangladesh: Ghiyasuddin Bahadur Shah, the last ruler of the dynasty is defeated and killed by the army of the Delhi Sultanate.
Belgium: Battle of Cassel: Philip VI of France defeats Flemish rebels led by Nicolaas Zannekin.
China: Yesün Temür's son Ragibagh Khan was appointed emperor of the Yuan dynasty in Shangdu.
The Yuan general El Temür crowned Jayaatu Khan Tugh Temür emperor in Khanbaliq.
Forces loyal to El Temür captured Shangdu and may have executed Ragibagh.
England: The Treaty of Edinburgh-Northampton, under which England recognised Scottish independence, was signed.
France: Charles IV died. He was succeeded by his cousin Philip VI.
Indinesia: Tribhuwana Wijayatunggadewi succeeds Jayanegara as ruler of Majapahit.
Russia: Ivan led a Horde army against the Grand Prince of Tver, also the Grand Prince of Vladimir. Ivan was allowed to replace him in the latter office.
